qas.question: What was the one ingredient of traditional English ale?
What country pioneered the introduction of hops for beer production?
In what century was the process of using hops to produce beer introduced to England?
In what century did the first independent breweries appear in England?
What businesses were the dominant brewers of beer in England by the close of the 17th century?

context: Traditional English ale was made solely from <a0_0>fermented malt<a0_0/>. The practice of adding hops to produce beer was introduced from <a1_0>the Netherlands<a1_0/> in the early <a2_0>15th<a2_0/> century. Alehouses would each brew their own distinctive ale, but independent breweries began to appear in the late <a3_0>17th<a3_0/> century. By the end of the century almost all beer was brewed by <a4_0>commercial breweries<a4_0/>.
